node.title: Care Packages complete, MP Shaun Chen honours Blankets for T.O.

content.value: As this school year comes to a close, Blankets for T.O. organized the Care Package Event which aimed to donate items to shelters around Scarborough. As we prepared our donations, we also received a visit from local Member of Parliament Shaun Chen, who honoured us with a certificate!
What is the Care Package Event?

The goal of the Care Package Event was to collect numerous items which are often in short supply in homeless shelters and gather them into personalized packages for donation. With the help of the shelter at Warden Woods Community Centre, we chose items that are important for safety during the pandemic, like hand sanitizer and masks, as well as personal hygiene items which are often in high demand. Additionally, our Blankets for T.O. members gave excellent ideas for items to include!

Our care packages were meticulously made by our Blankets for T.O. executive team on March 26th, 2021 while on the University of Toronto Scarborough campus. These care packages were subsequently donated to two shelters around Scarborough, including the respite site at the Warden Woods Community Centre.

title.en-US: Executives pack during the care package event, March 2020

description.en-US: Blankets for T.O. executives are seen packing the care packages for Blanket's for T.O.'s care package event on March 26th, 2021. Photo taken on the University of Toronto Scarborough campus.

content.value: What is in each care package?
Each care package is a drawstring bag containing items that are often tough to come by for residents of shelters. Each bag contains:
thermal blanket
hand sanitizer
face masks
headphones
toothbrush + toothpaste
rain poncho
adhesive bandages
pen
granola bars

personalized note: our kind members submitted to us messages of positivity and encouragement, which we added in as notes that care package recipients will read. We hope that these words can brighten up their days!

a vaccination leaflet: a short and sweet information card that tackles some of the common origins of vaccine hesitancy within the homeless community. We aim to help people in need to better understand vaccines and address their concerns to ultimately promote higher vaccination rates!
In total,
we packaged 800 items
! This works out to around
80 care packages in total
Blankets for T.O. receives an honour from MP Shaun Chen
We are so grateful that
Shaun Chen

, the Member of Parliament for Scarborough North, took time out of his busy schedule to drop by the University of Toronto Scarborough to talk to us about our event! We talked to him about homelessness in Scarborough and explained to him our plans for events and fundraising!
Blankets for T.O. is also honoured to have received a special certificate from Shaun Chen's office. The certificate recognizes organization's efforts "
to address homelessness by distributing essential items to those in need in the Greater Toronto Area
". Our "
generosity and acts of care during the COVID-19 pandemic are greatly valued and will significantly impact our community
Below are photos of our co-founders accepting this special and customized certificate:

title.en-US: MP Shaun Chen gives certificate to cofounders

description.en-US: Pictures of Blankets for T.O. co-founders accepting a certificate from Member of Parliament Shaun Chen during the Care Package Event on March 26th, 2021.

content.value: The Care Package Event comes to a close

The Blankets for T.O. care package event was a complete success! We would like to thank the executive team that organized such a daunting event. Thanks to our members for giving us their input about items to donate and offering us help in obtaining them. Thank you MP Shaun Chen for making our Care Package Event much more special!

childMarkdownRemark.html: During the Blankets for T.O. Care Package Event we gathered essential items to create personalized Care Package bags and donated them to local shelters. We also received a visit and a certificate from Member of Parliament Shaun Chen!

imagePreview.description: Poster image for the Blankets for T.O. Care Package Event, during March 2021.

node.title: Water.org UTSC x BTO Winter/Holiday Event

content.value: We collaborate with
Water.org UTSC
to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends and win prizes in games and raffles, while becoming better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.

childMarkdownRemark.html: We collaborate with Water.org UTSC to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.

imagePreview.description: Blankets for TO Logo with snow background

content.value: November 2020 at BTO was highlighted by two initiatives we were able to complete amid the difficult circumstances posed by the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Donation to a Homeless Shelter

We completed a food distribution initiative this month to distribute 10 packs of 60 donuts to the homeless across Toronto. One of our stops was to a homeless shelter at the Warden Woods Community Centre.
Our Day at the Hot Dog Stand
To help out local small businesses during the hardships of the COVID-19 pandemic, we decided to help promote an example of one through our social media! Blankets for T. O. worked with the owner of
Nasir's Gourmet Hot Dog Stand
, a food stand located right at the front of the UTSC campus.

Now that nearly all university classes have went online, his business has been struggling immensely with the lack of foot traffic. Blankets for T.O spent the day to take a photo shoot and to help promote his business. A video showcasing his business and his awesome food was uploaded to our
TikTok, immediately getting traffic and likes! View the video
here
Be sure to check his food out when you get the chance to. Let's show our support to local families and small businesses!

childMarkdownRemark.html: In November 2020, still amid the COVID-19 Pandemic, BTO engaged in a donut distribution initiative while also helping to promote a local small business on campus.

imagePreview.description: A split image of our events in November 2020; Nasir's Hot Dog Stand promotion and our donut distribution initiative.

content.value: October 2020 for Blankets for T.O. will be remembered for two events that we organized for the UTSC community.
We started off the Fall semester by organizing an open giveaway for a $20 Amazon gift card and Blankets for T.O. membership.

In the spirit of Halloween and as a de-stressor after exams, we hosted a pumpkin carving competition open to all UTSC students. Students were able to socialize and have a good time while competing between each other to carve the coolest pumpkin they could. The pumpkins carved were awesome! Thanks to all those who participated!

childMarkdownRemark.html: In October, Blankets for T.O. hosted a pumpkin carving contest for UTSC students and giveaway.

content.value: Given the ever-present circumstances of the COVID-19 pandemic, the meet and greet for the start of the Fall 2020 term at UTSC moved online to Zoom. We introduced Blankets for T.O. and shared our vision to UTSC students and prospective members.
It was also at this time that we further extended our social media presence. You can now reach us over Facebook, Instagram, and Tiktok! All our links can be reached via our
Contact page

childMarkdownRemark.html: Blankets for T.O. held a meet and greet over Zoom at the start of the Fall term to introduce ourselves to the community!

imagePreview.description: Blankets for TO Logo with snow background

content.value: To mark Valentine's Day, BTO members organized a blanket distribution!

We embarked on a 5 kilometre journey around downtown Toronto and distributed thermal blankets to the homeless. The weather was cold, but we remained warm and friendly! Here are pictures we took of just some of the donations we were able to make.
Money earned through membership fees, donations, and events held by Blankets for T.O. will go towards purchasing blankets for future blanket distributions like this one!

childMarkdownRemark.html: Read about how BTO members distributed blankets in downtown Toronto on a chilly Valentine's Day.

content.value: BTO successfully hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community. First of all, thank you to all those students that were able to take the time to come! It was amazing to see and meet all of you. The agenda of the session was to inform students about how they could contribute to BTO, including how they could become a member, apply for more senior positions, donate to the cause, and become a volunteer at future events.
It also wouldn't be a Blankets for T.O. meeting if we did not show off our blankets! In case you missed it, here it was:
Blankets for T.O. is looking forward to working with the community! For those who were not able to attend, do not worry, we will have plenty of updates through our social media and website!

childMarkdownRemark.html: BTO hosted a meet and greet at the University of Toronto Scarborough for students to introduce BTO to the community.
